definition: earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to pile up/to heap up/a mass/pile/heap/stack/large amount

sentences.english: Dotted amongst the sparse trees were a dozen low mounds.
sentences.chinese: 在那些稀疏树木间，有一些很矮的土堆以点状分布。

sentences.english: On the other side was the horse, more frightened than ever.
sentences.chinese: 马在这个石土堆的另一边，望上往比先前更加恐惊。

sentences.english: He pointed to a small hill on the edge of the village.
sentences.chinese: 他指向村边的一个小土堆。

sentences.english: Will they revive the stones out of the dust heaps, though they are burned?
sentences.chinese: 要从土堆里拿出火烧的石头再立墙么？

sentences.english: Investigations showed that excavated dirt piled next to the building may have caused the collapse.
sentences.chinese: 调查称怀疑倒塌是由于挖掘出的散土堆在建筑附近。

sentences.english: He dug until the hole was deepest and the dirt pile was at its highest.
sentences.chinese: 他一直挖，直到坑已经非常深，土堆得非常高。

sentences.english: Ulcers is what you get from climbing mountains over mole hills .
sentences.chinese: 把小土堆当作高山来爬，你会得溃疡。

sentences.english: A mountain is any hill 100 feet above sea level.
sentences.chinese: 高于100英尺的土堆都叫高山。

sentences.english: The mound behind us looks like a pyramid.
sentences.chinese: 我们身后的这座土堆就像金字塔。
啊，这座土堆就是陵墓啊？

definition: Shenkeng township in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
to heap earth (to close a tomb)/a mound (covering a tomb)
grave/tomb/graveyard/cemetery/fig. one's native place (where one's ancestors are buried)
embankment or foothpath between paddy fields
